creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
description: pointillist style; shades of white, blue, blue-grey, cream; snow falling; snow-covered ground with two pairs of tracks in foreground, LRQ; five snow-covered evergreen trees
text: Gustaf Fjaestad made the Swedish winter landscape his hallmark. In hundreds of paintings, he explored the myriad effects of light upon snow. In Winter Landscape, he depicts a magical atmosphere, where a pair of ski tracks lead into the distant forest, suggesting the solitary enjoyment of a sunny, winter afternoon. He employs a personal form of Pointillism, using a pattern of dots and lines to create a snowscape of calm natural beauty.
title: Winter Landscape
